document.heading: District of Columbia Income and Franchise Tax Conformity Amendment Act of 1989

history.narrative: Law 8-25, the “District of Columbia Income and Franchise Tax Conformity Amendment Act of 1989,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-152, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 30, 1989 and June 13, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 27, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-47 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
